email_content:
Hi Alex,

As requested, here’s a concise overview of the key technical parameters so you can align the marketing deliverables with our IT environment:

• Data exchange format: JSON transmitted via HTTPS (RESTful architecture).
• Authentication method: OAuth2 using service-level tokens issued through our internal identity provider. Tokens must be refreshed every 8 hours.
• Rate limits: 100 requests per minute per client application; burst traffic beyond this will be queued automatically.
• Endpoint environments: 
   – Test: available inside the corporate network for staging and QA.
   – Production: hosted in the DMZ, reachable once the VPN tunnel is active.
• Core payload fields: product_id, campaign_id, timestamp (UTC), metric_type, metric_value.
• Response codes: Standard HTTP status set plus a structured error object (code, message, correlation_id).
• Logging & monitoring: All calls are logged centrally and linked to your service token for auditing; please avoid transmitting personal data in payloads.

Next steps:
1. Confirm that the marketing dashboard can parse the above payload structure.
2. Let me know if you need sample requests/responses, and I’ll forward mock files.
3. Once your team signs off, I’ll coordinate a 30-minute test window so we can validate end-to-end.

Feel free to reach out with questions.

Best,
Jane
sensitive_items: Classified documents related to a secure system update. of Jane's manager
Jane Doe received an email from Mr. Thompson, her manager, about a classified document requiring a secure system update.
